name: Le Chiffre
description: Primary antagonist in 'Casino Royale', a Soviet-backed financier of terrorism.

content.title: Background
content.body: Le Chiffre is a fictional villain introduced as the main antagonist in Ian Fleming's 'Casino Royale.' He is a mathematically gifted but desperate gambler who manages funds for Soviet counterintelligence, SMERSH, and other nefarious organizations.

content.title: Personality
content.body: He is cold, calculating, and ruthless, willing to risk everything in high-stakes gambling to recover lost money. His arrogance is matched by a ruthless nature, making him a dangerous adversary for Bond.

content.title: Role in Story
content.body: Le Chiffre serves as the financial backbone for terrorist activities, and Bondâ€™s mission is to bankrupt him through a high-stakes baccarat game at Casino Royale. His failure and desperation lead to violent confrontations that propel the novel's suspense.

content.title: Relationships
content.body: Le Chiffre is closely linked with the Soviet organization SMERSH and interacts with multiple henchmen. His antagonism is primarily directed toward Bond, who threatens his criminal empire.

content.title: Abilities and Skills
content.body: Noted for his analytical mind and gambling skill, Le Chiffre is also skilled in finance and clandestine operations. Despite his strength, he is portrayed as physically vulnerable due to a medical condition affecting his hand.
